intro: Stroemia capparoides, commonly known as the rock pepper or rock gothite, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, round fruits that are dispersed by animals. Stroemia capparoides is an important component of its native ecosystems, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
